summary: In the acknowledgments of this book, Mark Manson reflects on the journey of writing it, highlighting the struggles and triumphs he experienced throughout the process. He expresses profound gratitude to his editor, agent, web team, and the supportive friends who helped him during difficult times. Manson acknowledges that the writing was often challenging, yet the support of others played a crucial role in bringing the book to life. He emphasizes the importance of collaboration and community in creating something meaningful. Ultimately, he also expresses deep appreciation for his wife, Fernanda, for her unwavering support and love.

slides.section_body: Writing this book tested my hope and resilience in ways I never anticipated. Many nights, I found myself staring in disbelief at the challenges that seemed insurmountable. Yet, through perseverance and support, I produced something I am proud of.
slides.quote: Sometimes, it seems everything is irreparably messed up.

slides.section_body: I'm incredibly grateful for my editor, Luke Dempsey, who stood beside me through the upheaval. His contributions were invaluable in shaping my ideas into this final product. His dedication felt like a lifeline during the toughest moments.
slides.quote: You really came through in stoppage time.

slides.section_body: Mollie Glick has been nothing short of a fairy godmother in my life. Her ability to manifest opportunities has amazed me time and again. Her belief in me and this project has been a constant source of motivation.
slides.quote: Amazing things just appear in my life out of nowhere.

slides.section_body: A big thank you to my web team, Philip Kemper and Drew Birnie. They have supported me in making my online presence strong and engaging. Their talent keeps me looking more competent than I sometimes feel.
slides.quote: I'm incredibly proud of what we've built online.

slides.section_body: I'm thankful for friends like Nir Eyal, who pushed me to keep writing, and Taylor Pearson, James Clear, and Ryan Holiday, who listened during my moments of doubt. Their encouragement helped me channel my anxieties into creativity.
slides.quote: You all patiently offered advice when I needed it most.

slides.section_body: I greatly appreciate the friends who took the time to read my rough drafts and provide feedback. Their insights guided me through the writing process and helped refine my ideas.
slides.quote: Your notes and feedback were invaluable.

slides.section_body: A special shout out to my book club, the NYC Chapter of the Gentleman’s Literary Safari. Little did I know how these discussions would shape my perspective and contribute to the book’s development.
slides.quote: Much of this book was born from our long philosophical meanderings.

slides.section_body: WS’s approach to life, both chaotic and grounding, inspired me in unexpected ways. His words remind us that sometimes, tackling more than we can manage can lead to profound insights.
slides.quote: The trick is you bite off more than you can chew… and then you chew it.

slides.section_body: I cannot end without thanking my wife, Fernanda Neute. Her unwavering support and love have been my guiding light. She embodies the essence of commitment, and for that, I'm eternally grateful.
slides.quote: Thank you for the gift of commitment and self-limitation.

slides.section_body: This journey has taught me the significance of community and the power of collective support. It’s through our connections that we can overcome doubts and create something greater than ourselves.
slides.quote: Being is always the being of a being.
